intro: Osbeckia koti-gueda, commonly known as the Gueda's osbeckia, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. Osbeckia koti-gueda is often found in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the high-altitude environments of its native range. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in the region.
